option.optiontext: So, what are you expecting to happen?

option.optiontext: You'll let me use your staff?

option.optiontext: So an 'Entity' from within the 'Curtain'? Seems a little vague.

node.text: It's as much as I ever came across in ancient writings. When the Qaeshtari discovered varying dimensions of existence, they learned that those were separated by a world that was not quite a world, a world between worlds - the 'Curtain of Etherlight'.
It may be they never fully understood it either. From what I gather, it is a place that can neither be seen nor entered, but one must pass through it in order to pass between the different worlds.
But every time you pierce through it, something within it resists. Something that is hard to define... Perhaps not quite a creature, but certainly more than a mere force of nature.

option.optiontext: You'd let me use your staff to defend against it?

You have been a decent servant to me thus far, Lord Aercrest. Once we are through with this, I promise, you will have to hear my voice no longer. For now, I wish you to act as my hand in carrying out vengeance against Eloria.

Travel to the city of Thornhill and look for this man of hers - Arren Oakenthorn. In the wake of a recent plague, the young druid took on the role of a noble healer and a herbalist within the city. How quaint indeed.
Pay him a surprise visit. I expect he and Eloria maintain contact somehow through magic. Use this connection, Lord Aercrest, and slay Arren before her very eyes.

As you can see, no portal was built here. Nonetheless, this scrying platform is a point of convergence for dormant Qaeshtari magic. It was no stretch for one such as I to tap into that magic, to connect with the portals.

Today it falls.
With the crystal and the spellbound bark you have brought me, I can fashion a focus for my magic.
A focus that allows me to channel enough power to even challenge the works of the Ancients! Observe, slave!
I must perform the scrying itself to unveil Eloria, but not here.
Across the small pond east there remains a Qaeshtari stone circle; a place dedicated for ritual spells. Meet me there and we may begin.
Whatever happens, my channeling must not be disturbed. Use my staff if you have to.
It won't matter whether there are wolves or bears, or an immortal extradimensional monster. It will disintegrate them all the same.
Brace yourself, Lord Aercrest. It's time I begin.
I trust even you must be familiar with the witches of the Silvermirror Fen, Lord Aercrest.
Folklore would have you believe there's only ever been the one, immortal witch.
But in truth, there have been many over the centuries. And at times, she has been an entire coven.
But now the witch has come to be none other than my beloved ex-companion Eloria Mirvren. A clever disguise, I suppose.
It appears some time back she defeated the hateful hag that was the previous witch and decided to adopt her identity.
Coincidentally she came to rescue a young druid, Arren Irethorn, from the witch's captivity. Curious...
The two developed a rather close bond. I wonder, does Eloria not know?
Love hurts... literally...

This monolith is merely a part of a larger structure buried beneath dirt.
